item.title: CSC 201: Data Structures and Algorithms
item.description: Syllabus Section A: Wednesdays and Fridays - 12:30pm to 1:45pm

Communication-Avoiding Machine Learning Gram Matrix Partitioning for CA-ML. Machine learning has gained renewed interest in recent years due to advances in computer hardware (processing power and high-bandwidth storage) and the availability of large amounts of data which can be used to develop accurate, robust models.
Wake Forest University Fall 2022 CSC 201 Section B: Data Structures and Algorithms
Peer-Reviewed Journal Papers A. Devarakonda, K. Fountoulakis, J. Demmel and M.
Bio Aditya Devarakonda is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at Wake Forest University.
